greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of positive solutions to "numbers that are n times sum of their digits".
comment: It appears that the largest terms occur when n=1 mod 9 and moderately large terms when n=4 or 7 mod 9.
link: Giovanni Resta, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: a(13)=3 since the only three solutions are 117=9*13, 156=12*13 and 195=15*13.
maple: # may stop if x/digsum(x)>n, so if x/#digits(x) > 9*n
results.author: _Henry Bottomley_, Sep 12 2000
